page.title: 08LYTHAM SEAFRONT/SHORELINE
page.content: Behind Lytham windmill is the old lifeboat house.It is no longer used by the R.N.L.I.due to the construction of a new lifeboat house.It was first built in 1844 and was adopted by the R.N.L.I. in 1851.The first ship was the{"Eleanor Cecily"}after Mrs Clifton whose family funded the scheme.The boat,unfortunately,capsised and 6 of the 9 crew drowned.At present the Council are renovating it into a maritime or lifeboat museum. The new lifeboat house,originally a mussel purification station ,opened in 1959.The present lifeboat is an off-shore boat,an inshore vessel is used for minor incidents.There have been 16 rescues in the last 12 months. 20 crewmen are on call at this station.At night both boats are launched as the inshore boat cannot go out in the dark alone.
